channel.title: I (joined 8 minutes ago..) Have come across a problem
channel.description:
(please exuse me for usine bad technechal terms and being hard to understand) ok so i put the script SumPowerMiner into scar and umm i did the crosshair thingy and listed the player name and pressed..... the "go" button when this message appeared
succesfully compiled srl compiled in 31 msec [runtime error] : out of range in line 35 in script C:/documents and settings\me\local settings\ temporary internet files\ content.ie5\ KPIZ492B\spm_v0[1] .82. scar
I am sorry if i did something so stupid that a fencepost could've done it. please respond :|

item.title: I (joined 8 minutes ago..) Have come across a problem
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

HowManyPlayers is the desired array length,
NumberOfPlayers is a procedure which sets the array length

Read full topic
item.source: I (joined 8 minutes ago..) Have come across a problem

item.title: I (joined 8 minutes ago..) Have come across a problem
item.dc:creator: @Starblaster100 Starblaster100
item.description:
@Starblaster100 wrote:

just above the “player array” (The part which Nashi has highlighted) will be a variable called “NumberOfPlayers” or something similar to that.

If you are only using 1 player, you have to change that number to 1. if you are using 2, you have to change it to 2 etc. If you say you are using 2 players, you must input data for 2 players.

This “NumberOfPlayers” number has to be equal to how many players you have setup in the DeclarePlayers procedure.

Also, please do not double post. read the rules.

Read full topic
item.source: I (joined 8 minutes ago..) Have come across a problem

item.title: I (joined 8 minutes ago..) Have come across a problem
item.dc:creator: @rip_slice rip_slice
item.description:
@rip_slice wrote:

ok so you put the username inside the little ‘’ things right?[br][size=1]Posted on: July 31, 2007, 07:00:09 PM[/size][hr]sigh… yeah if i’m not being too much of a pain in the butt could you just go ahead and highlight all the places i need to fill in junk.

Read full topic

item.title: I (joined 8 minutes ago..) Have come across a problem
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

You still have Players[1].Name := ''; Players[2].Name := ''; Players[3].Name := ''; Players[4].Name := '';
Even though you didnt declare that many players, Even though you might declare 2 players, the player array starts at 0 so Players[0] is actually Player 1, make sure you delete any other Player stuff that you don’t need but be careful not to delete what you are using

Read full topic
